Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Scarab
Description: Small scarab pierced longitudinally. The details are succinct: on the back the head and clypeus are only schematically rendered. Two circles represent the legs. An ibex is carved on the reverse, a rare motif found at the end of the Middle Kingdom.
